Grateful to my 13 Republican colleagues who joined us in voting this week to stop the #FakeEmergency and protect our constitutional balance of power. I hope our Senate colleagues also vote with conscience. https://www.dallasnews.com/news/donald-trump-1/2019/02/26/house-democrats-rebuke-trumps-border-wall-emergency-back-joaquin-castros-disapproval-resolution …
I will keep fighting for commonsense solutions to keep our communities safe and prevent tragedies caused by gun violence while strengthening mental health services in this country.

The majority of people with mental illness do not engage in violence against others, and most violence is caused by factors other than mental illness. It is important to remember these individuals are far more likely to be the victims of violence than the perpetrators.

We must keep guns out of the hands of people who should not have access to them, such as domestic abusers and those with violent histories, and it is critical we do this without stigmatizing those with mental illness.

This bipartisan bill would require background checks for all gun purchases, with some reasonable exceptions, and is one of many long overdue steps forward to begin to address this epidemic, which claims over 36,000 lives every year on average.

Joined my colleagues in wearing orange and standing in solidarity with millions of Americans impacted by gun violence after we passed H.R. 8, ending 8 years of silence and inaction by the NRA-backed Republican-led House. #EndGunViolence pic.twitter.com/LJAf0SlKsl

The #MedicareforAll Act will provide comprehensive, affordable health care for EVERY person living in the U.S., including life-saving mental health services. Proud to have supported it since 2005 and to be joining @RepJayapal & 100+ of our colleagues in introducing it today. pic.twitter.com/B2Cpb3hash

Just voted to terminate Trump’s #FakeEmergency declaration. Glad to have bipartisan support in House and hope Senate follows suit. Congress is a separate and coequal branch of government, and we will not be bullied.

We have worked for years to protect our treasured #PublicLands. Glad to finally be voting on a bipartisan package today, which protects wilderness and permanently reauthorizes #LWCF. This is a huge win #ForThePeople that saves taxpayers $9 million! pic.twitter.com/5pf6JT1toJ

Proud to join my colleagues today in introducing HR 4, the Voting Rights Advancement Act. Those who oppose these efforts want us to believe racial discrimination only exists in history books. They are wrong. We must #RestoreTheVote. pic.twitter.com/xFHVHQkbPz
We in the @HispanicCaucus & the entire Congress need to know how many families were separated and what the administration’s plan is to reunify every child with their loved ones. #EndFamilySeparation

Separating children from their parents is inhumane, indefensible, and is a form of emotional violence. The Trump admin owes Congress answers and must put an end to this cruel practice. #EndFamilySeparation

H.R. 1139 aims to prevent assaults, increase public safety by eliminating blind spots, and provide additional upgrades to the transportation systems in the SGV and nationwide. Transit workers take very seriously their jobs to ensure our safety; it is time we prioritize theirs.

On Tuesday I visited the El Monte Bus Station and met with @metrolosangeles officials and operators. Appreciated our discussion on bus safety, which included the Transit Operator and Pedestrian Protection Act (H.R. 1139), bipartisan legislation I introduced last week. pic.twitter.com/2mwhciH5q2
We must understand that their voices matter and that civic participation is important no matter what age you may be.

I was glad to answer questions from 7th and 8th graders, and I am encouraged to see their interest in government. Young people’s concerns are too often ignored by elected officials because they do not vote.

After receiving an inquiry by a student who dreams of one day being a member of Congress/engineer, I spent this morning with that youngster and other students at St. Louis of France School in La Puente. pic.twitter.com/X1W1hqO8xO

I thank @RepJohnKatko for his continued partnership, and I am grateful to all of our colleagues for joining in support of this critical legislation.

Improved access to services for prevention, early identification, and intervention has helped countless youth in our communities thrive in school, at home, and in life, and it is a model that should be expanded to serve families across America.

The Mental Health Services for Students Act builds on the great success of our youth suicide prevention program in LA County, where we are raising #mentalhealth awareness, reducing harmful #stigma, and connecting our future leaders to life-saving care. https://napolitano.house.gov/media/press-releases/napolitano-katko-introduce-mental-health-services-students-act …

John Dingell was a giant of a man who was as gentle as can be. It was a true privilege serving alongside him, fighting for American families. Through his illness he continued to smile and warm our hearts. Sending all my love to Debbie Dingell and the entire Dingell family

Speaking to the press earlier my colleagues & I lifted up the stories of our #SOTU guests, which included those affected by Trump’s heartless immigration policies as well as individuals whose lives were disrupted by the costly government shutdown pic.twitter.com/kP70Myo45V
Now a U.S. citizen, Isaac draws hope from his own immigrant experience, as he looks toward future generations and endeavors to carry out Archbishop Gomez’s vision of humane immigration reform.

Through his vocation, he witnesses firsthand the harm this administration’s failed immigration policies have inflicted on our communities and recognizes the need for fair, compassionate solutions that respect human dignity and the rule of law.

My #SOTU guest, Isaac Cuevas of Duarte, works for the Archdiocese of Los Angeles on immigration issues and is an immigrant himself. He came to this country with his parents from Mexico at age 2, thanks to President Reagan, and his story is #OurHispanicSOTU. pic.twitter.com/ogrgPSUZjH
